intro: Diodia ekmanii, commonly known as the narrowleaf diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It has a short lifespan and is considered an annual or biennial species. Diodia ekmanii is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
